Detailed Description

Native object base.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum flusspferd::native_object_base::property_access [protected]

Possible property access methods.

Can be combined by bitwise or.

Enumerator:
property_qualified  The property access uses the .

or [] operator: obj.id or obj[id], not id.

property_assigning  The property appears on the left-hand side of an assignment.
property_detecting  The property is being used in code like "<code>if (o.p) ...</code>", or a similar idiom where the apparent purpose of the property access is to detect whether the property exists.
property_declaring  The property is being declared in a var, const, or function declaration.
property_classname  class name used when constructing.

(???)

enum flusspferd::native_object_base::property_mode [protected]

Possible modes for native_object_base::property_op.

Enumerator:
property_add  Used just before a new property is added to an object.
property_delete  Used during most property deletions, even when the object has no property with the given name / index.

Will not be used for permanent properties.

property_get  Used as the default getter for new properties or for non-existing properties.
property_set  Used as the default setter for new properties.

flusspferd::native_object_base::native_object_base ( object const &  o  )  [protected]

Constructor.

Immediately associates with object o.

Do not use with arbitrary objects.

Member Function Documentation

virtual value flusspferd::native_object_base::enumerate_next ( boost::any &  iter  )  [protected, virtual]

Virtual method invoked to advance the enumeration and pull out the next property name / index.

Default implementation: return value().

Should return value() (undefined) to stop the enumeration.

Parameters:
[in,out] iter The opaque iterator.
Returns:
The next property name / index.

virtual boost::any flusspferd::native_object_base::enumerate_start ( int &  num_properties  )  [protected, virtual]

Virtual method invoked to start enumerating properties.

Will be called only if class_info::custom_enumerate is activated.

Default implementation: return boost::any().

Parameters:
[out] num_properties The number of properties, if that can be computed in advance. Otherwise should be set to zero. Pre-initialized to zero.
Returns:
An opaque iterator for use by enumerate_next.

Get the native object associated with a Javascript object.

A reference to the object.

virtual void flusspferd::native_object_base::property_op ( property_mode  mode,
value const &  id,
value &  data 
) [protected, virtual]

Virtual method invoked for property addition, deletion, read access and write access.

Default implementation: stub.

Parameters:
mode The reason for invocation.
id The property name / index.
[in,out] data The old/new value of the property.
See also:
property_mode

virtual bool flusspferd::native_object_base::property_resolve ( value const &  id,
unsigned  access 
) [protected, virtual]

Virtual method invoked when a property is not found on an object.

Default implementation: stub that returns false.

It can be used to implement lazy properties.

If possible, id will be an integer, or a string otherwise.

Parameters:
id The property name / index.
access Information about the kind of property access. A combination of property_access values.

virtual void flusspferd::native_object_base::self_call ( call_context &  x  )  [protected, virtual]

Virtual method invoked whenever the object is called as if it were a function.

Default implementation: throw an exception.

Parameters:
x The call context.

virtual void flusspferd::native_object_base::trace ( tracer &  trc  )  [protected, virtual]

Virtual method invoked whenever the object has to be traced.

Default implementation: stub.

For each value that is an otherwise unreachable member of the object and that should be protected from garbage collection, call trc(x).

Parameters:
trc The tracer to be used.
See also:
Garbage collection
